qas.question: Who was the inspiration for Methodism?
How many Methodists are there in the world today?
How did the Methodist movement spread so far and wide?

context: Methodism identifies principally with the theology of <a0_0>John Wesley<a0_0/>—an <a2_0>Anglican priest<a2_0/> and evangelist. This evangelical movement originated as a revival within the 18th-century Church of England and became a separate Church following Wesley's death. Because of <a4_0>vigorous missionary activity<a4_0/>, the movement spread throughout the British Empire, the United States, and beyond, today claiming <a3_0>approximately 80 million<a3_0/> adherents worldwide. Originally it appealed especially to <a1_0>workers, agricultural workers, and slaves<a1_0/>.
